intro: [WRONG START] Boronia obcordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf boronia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in heathland and dry forest environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and obcordate, giving it a distinctive appearance. Borbonia obcordata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a member of the Rutaceae family.
